articles.headline: Car Seats to Face Crash-Test Standards
articles.snippet: A proposed rule to require child-seat manufacturers to meet minimum federal standards for side-impact crashes has been added to the Federal Register.
articles.abstract: A proposed rule to require child-seat manufacturers to meet minimum federal standards for side-impact crashes has been added to the Federal Register.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Federal regulators moved on Wednesday to address a glaring hole in auto safety rules by proposing new crash-test standards to better protect children in car seats.
articles.byline: By Bill Vlasic and Cheryl Jensen

articles.headline: Robot Vacuum Makes War on Cat Hair
articles.snippet: The Roomba 880 from iRobot has the same hockey-puck look as the previous models, but does a superior job in cleaning dust bunnies and pet hair. But the cost may scare off prospective buyers.
articles.abstract: The Roomba 880 from iRobot has the same hockey-puck look as the previous models, but does a superior job in cleaning dust bunnies and pet hair. But the cost may scare off prospective buyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: The robots are coming. Every week, it seems, announcements hail a coming era of personal robots: machines that will ingratiate themselves into our homes by liberating us from despised chores like folding fitted sheets.

articles.headline: U.S. Offshore Wind Farm, Made in Europe
articles.snippet: The promise of new jobs and work failed to come true, revealing shortcomings in the American offshore wind industry.
articles.abstract: The promise of new jobs and work failed to come true, revealing shortcomings in the American offshore wind industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIDDLEBOROUGH, Mass. — Carl Horstmann strode around the floor of his factory here, passing welders honing head-high metal tubes as sparks flew. He is one of a dying breed: the owner of Mass Tank, a steel tank manufacturer in a down-at-the-heels region that was once a hub of the craft.

articles.headline: A Tell-All Born From Goldman Gossip
articles.snippet: Comments heard in the Goldman Sachs elevators are making it into a book.
articles.abstract: Comments heard in the Goldman Sachs elevators are making it into a book.
articles.lead_paragraph: The parody Twitter account @GSElevator, a stream of darkly funny, frequently callous anonymous snippets purportedly overheard in elevators at Goldman Sachs, has offered comments on a dizzying range of topics to its more than 600,000 followers.

articles.headline: Gay Marriages Confront Catholic School Rules
articles.snippet: Some young Catholics have been mystified by a wave of firings and forced resignations at Roman Catholic institutions around the country, most often over gay educators’ decisions to marry.
articles.abstract: Some young Catholics have been mystified by a wave of firings and forced resignations at Roman Catholic institutions around the country, most often over gay educators’ decisions to marry.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAMMAMISH, Wash. — Eastside Catholic prides itself on teaching acceptance. At the end of Crusader Way, by the school’s entrance, banners hang celebrating “relationships” and exhorting passers-by to “remember to take care of each other.” Students use a sign-language gesture to remind one another of the school’s emphasis on unconditional love.

articles.headline: Exporting U.S. Rules for Foreign Banks
articles.snippet: Overseas banks like Barclays, Deutsche Bank and Credit Suisse have not had to comply with parts of the Dodd-Frank Act that aim to strengthen the capital they must maintain to absorb losses.
articles.abstract: Overseas banks like Barclays, Deutsche Bank and Credit Suisse have not had to comply with parts of the Dodd-Frank Act that aim to strengthen the capital they must maintain to absorb losses.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the biggest loopholes on Wall Street may soon close.

articles.headline: Leaning Right in Hollywood, Under a Lens
articles.snippet: The Internal Revenue Service is reviewing the activities of the conservative group Friends of Abe in connection with its application for tax-exempt status.
articles.abstract: The Internal Revenue Service is reviewing the activities of the conservative group Friends of Abe in connection with its application for tax-exempt status.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — In a famously left-leaning Hollywood, where Democratic fund-raisers fill the social calendar, Friends of Abe stands out as a conservative group that bucks the prevailing political winds.
articles.byline: By Michael Cieply and Nicholas Confessore

articles.headline: When Political Spouse Helps Cause a Downfall
articles.snippet: In most tales of political careers destroyed by personal weaknesses, it is the officeholder’s spouse who winds up humiliated. But there is another drama that plays out, too.
articles.abstract: In most tales of political careers destroyed by personal weaknesses, it is the officeholder’s spouse who winds up humiliated. But there is another drama that plays out, too.
articles.lead_paragraph: Virginia’s first lady needed a designer dress for her husband’s inauguration.

articles.headline: Upward Mobility Has Not Declined, Study Says
articles.snippet: The study, which contradicts claims by politicians in both parties, used more data than previous ones.
articles.abstract: The study, which contradicts claims by politicians in both parties, used more data than previous ones.
articles.lead_paragraph: The odds of moving up — or down — the income ladder in the United States have not changed appreciably in the last 20 years, according to a large new academic study that contradicts politicians in both parties who have claimed that income mobility is falling.

articles.headline: Huge ‘Super PAC’ Is Moving Early to Back Clinton
articles.snippet: Priorities USA Action, which played a pivotal role in President Obama’s re-election, formally aligned itself with Hillary Rodham Clinton’s undeclared presidential ambitions.
articles.abstract: Priorities USA Action, which played a pivotal role in President Obama’s re-election, formally aligned itself with Hillary Rodham Clinton’s undeclared presidential ambitions.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Obama political operation that once buried Hillary Rodham Clinton’s White House ambitions is now rapidly converging around her possible 2016 presidential bid, conferring on Mrs. Clinton enormous early advantages in money, expertise and voter targeting techniques.

articles.headline: Senator Is Lobbying for Inquiry on Herbalife
articles.snippet: Senator Edward J. Markey has asked regulators to look into the business practices of Herbalife, the nutritional supplements company that has long been in the cross hairs of the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman.
articles.abstract: Senator Edward J. Markey has asked regulators to look into the business practices of Herbalife, the nutritional supplements company that has long been in the cross hairs of the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman.
articles.lead_paragraph: The hedge fund manager William A. Ackman walked the halls of Congress last year, telling any lawmaker who would listen that he believed Herbalife, a nutritional supplements company, was a fraud. He finally got a break on Thursday, when Senator Edward J. Markey of Massachusetts sent letters to federal regulators urging them to investigate the company.
articles.byline: By William Alden and Michael S. Schmidt
